Description: Rim and body fragment of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed streakily with one band of added red framed in white; exterior, pinkish slip; animal frieze at ri:m front part of a grazing wild goat to right and front part of a dog to left; filling ornaments: roundels, quartered lozenges and rosette; below,band with added red band lined in white, above frieze with maender, square patterns and dots; drill hole on broken edge for sampling for clay analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.092)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.3; p.663, pl.8.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
